content: Meeting outside Paris last week, top officials from France, Germany and Italy pledged to pursue a coordinated economic policy to counter stepped-up efforts by Washington and Beijing to protect their own homegrown businesses.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Chris Cameron
title: Biden, in Pennsylvania, speaks to the United Steelworkers.
description: President Biden is keeping his campaign focused on Pennsylvania, a swing state that is crucial to his re-election hopes, spoke on Wednesday at the United Steelworkers headquarters in Pittsburgh. Former President Donald J. Trump, his Republican opponent, will get a short reprieve from his felony criminal trial in New York with a scheduled break.
content: President Biden is keeping his campaign focused on Pennsylvania, a swing state that is crucial to his re-election hopes, spoke on Wednesday at the United Steelworkers headquarters in Pittsburgh. Former President Donald J. Trump, his Republican opponent, will get a short reprieve from his felony criminal trial in New York with a scheduled break.
source.name: The New York Times

title: Popcast (Deluxe): It’s Drake vs. Everybody … Who’s Winning?
description: Breaking down the convoluted recent beef between Drake and Kendrick Lamar (and Future, Metro Boomin, the Weeknd, ASAP Rocky, Rick Ross and more).
content: This week’s episode of Popcast (Deluxe), the weekly culture roundup show on YouTube hosted by Jon Caramanica and Joe Coscarelli, includes segments on:
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Natasha Frost
title: What’s in Our Queue? ‘Anatomy of a Fall’ and More
description: Natasha Frost shares five things she's recently heard, seen, and watched.
content: Natasha Frost shares five things she's recently heard, seen, and watched.
source.name: The New York Times

author: Illustrations by Tara Booth
title: The 16 Messages That Led to Love
description: Readers of the Modern Love column share the banter, emojis and wit that made them fall for each other.
content: Readers of the Modern Love column share the banter, emojis and wit that made them fall for each other.
source.name: The New York Times

title: Read Nemat Shafik’s Opening Remarks
description: In her prepared opening statement, Nemat Shafik, the president of Columbia University, laid out ways the university has been responding to antisemitism on campus.
content: In her prepared opening statement, Nemat Shafik, the president of Columbia University, laid out ways the university has been responding to antisemitism on campus.
source.name: The New York Times

title: Read Virginia Foxx’s Opening Remarks
description: Representative Virginia Foxx, who chairs the House Education and the Workforce Committee, listed the reasons for calling Wednesday’s hearing on campus antisemitism in her prepared opening remarks.
content: Representative Virginia Foxx, who chairs the House Education and the Workforce Committee, listed the reasons for calling Wednesday’s hearing on campus antisemitism in her prepared opening remarks.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By The Associated Press and Reuters
title: Long Lines Form Outside Reopened Bakery in Gaza City
description: Workers handed out bags of fresh bread from one of the two bakeries that reopened in Gaza City this week.
content: Workers handed out bags of fresh bread from one of the two bakeries that reopened in Gaza City this week.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By The Associated Press
title: Heavy Rain in Oman Causes Deadly Flash Floods
description: Muddy floodwaters inundated neighborhoods, mangled cars and damaged roads.
content: Muddy floodwaters inundated neighborhoods, mangled cars and damaged roads.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By The Associated Press and Reuters
title: Hezbollah Launches Attack on Northern Israeli Border Village
description: Hezbollah said its attack on the village of Arab al-Aramashe was in response to Israeli airstrikes a day earlier.
content: Hezbollah said its attack on the village of Arab al-Aramashe was in response to Israeli airstrikes a day earlier.
source.name: The New York Times

author: By Linda Qiu, Claire Hogan, James Surdam and Noah Throop
title: Debunking Trump’s Misleading and False Claims About His Court Cases
description: Linda Qiu, a fact check reporter for The New York Times, analyzes some of Donald Trump’s false and misleading statements about his ongoing court cases.
content: Linda Qiu, a fact check reporter for The New York Times, analyzes some of Donald Trump’s false and misleading statements about his ongoing court cases.
source.name: The New York Times
